SEARCH
Package controller

Class Coordinator

java.lang.Object
controller.Coordinator
public class Coordinator extends Object
The Coordinator class is responsible for managing the network (Red), logic (Logic), and graphical user interface (Gui) instances keeping them in sync.

This class provides methods to manipulate and retrieve information about the network, including adding, deleting, and modifying devices (equipos), connections (conexiones), locations (ubicaciones), cable types (tipoCable), and port types (tipoPuerto). It also includes methods for network operations such as finding the shortest path, calculating maximum bandwidth, and pinging devices.

    • addConnection

      public void addConnection(Conexion conexion) throws InvalidConexionException
      Adds a connection (Conexion) to the network.

      This method attempts to add the connection to both the logic layer and the network (Red). If the connection is invalid, an InvalidConexionException is thrown. The graphical user interface (Gui) is also updated to reflect the new connection.

      Parameters:
      conexion - the connection to be added
      Throws:
      InvalidConexionException - if the connection is invalid

    • deleteConnection

      public void deleteConnection(Conexion conexion) throws InvalidConexionException
      Deletes a connection (Conexion) from the network.

      This method removes the connection from the network (Red), logic layer, and graphical user interface (Gui).

      Parameters:
      conexion - the connection to be deleted
      Throws:
      InvalidConexionException - if the connection is invalid

    • modifyConnection

      public void modifyConnection(Conexion conexion) throws InvalidConexionException
      Modifies an existing connection (Conexion) in the network.

      This method attempts to modify the connection in the network (Red), logic layer, and graphical user interface (Gui). If the connection is invalid and cannot be modified, an InvalidConexionException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      conexion - the connection to be modified
      Throws:
      InvalidConexionException - if the connection is invalid

    • addEquipo

      public void addEquipo(Equipo equipo) throws InvalidEquipoException
      Adds a device (Equipo) to the network.

      This method attempts to add the device to the network (Red), logic layer, and graphical user interface (Gui). If the device is invalid and cannot be added, an InvalidEquipoException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      equipo - the device to be added
      Throws:
      InvalidEquipoException - if the device is invalid

    • deleteEquipo

      public void deleteEquipo(Equipo equipo) throws InvalidEquipoException
      Deletes a device (Equipo) from the network.

      This method removes the device from the network (Red), logic layer, and graphical user interface (Gui).

      Parameters:
      equipo - the device to be deleted
      Throws:
      InvalidEquipoException - if the device is invalid

    • modifyEquipo

      public void modifyEquipo(Equipo equipo) throws InvalidEquipoException
      Modifies an existing device (Equipo) in the network.

      This method attempts to modify the device in the network (Red), logic layer, and graphical user interface (Gui). If the device is invalid and cannot be modified, an InvalidEquipoException is thrown.

      Parameters:

      Throws:

    • getEquipos

      public List<Equipo> getEquipos()
      Gets the list of devices (equipos) in the network.
      Returns:
      a list of devices in the network

    • getEquiposKeys

      public String[] getEquiposKeys()
      Retrieves the keys of the equipment in the network.

      This method returns an array of strings that contains the keys of all the equipment in the network. The keys are obtained from the key set of the map of equipment maintained by the red instance. This method is useful for obtaining a list of identifiers for the available equipment in the network.

      Returns:
      an array of strings representing the keys of the equipment in the network.

    • getEquiposIps

      public String[] getEquiposIps()
      Retrieves the IP addresses of all devices (equipos) in the network.

      This method returns an array of strings containing the IP addresses of all devices in the network. The IP addresses are obtained from the network (Red) instance.

      Returns:
      an array of strings representing the IP addresses of all devices in the network

    • getEquipo

      public Equipo getEquipo(String codigo)
      Retrieves the equipment associated with the specified code.

      This method looks up and returns the equipment object that corresponds to the given code from the network's equipment map. If no equipment is found with the specified code, it returns null.

      Parameters:
      codigo - the code of the equipment to retrieve.
      Returns:
      the Equipo object associated with the specified code, or null if not found.

    • getEquiposMap

      public Map<String,Equipo> getEquiposMap()
      Gets the map of devices (equipos) in the network.

      This method retrieves the map of devices from the network (Red).

      Returns:
      a map where the key is the device code and the value is the device

    • addPuertoEquipo

      public void addPuertoEquipo(Equipo equipo, Puerto puerto) throws InvalidPuertoEquipoException
      Adds a port (Puerto) to a device (Equipo).

      This method attempts to add the port to the network (Red). If the port is invalid and cannot be added, an InvalidPuertoEquipoException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      equipo - the device (Equipo) to which the port is to be added
      puerto - the port to be added
      Throws:
      InvalidPuertoEquipoException - if the port is invalid

    • removePuertoEquipo

      public void removePuertoEquipo(Equipo equipo, Puerto puerto) throws InvalidPuertoEquipoException
      Removes a port (Puerto) from a device (Equipo).

      This method attempts to remove the port from the network (Red). If the port is invalid and cannot be removed, an InvalidPuertoEquipoException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      equipo - the device (Equipo) from which the port is to be removed
      puerto - the port to be removed
      Throws:
      InvalidPuertoEquipoException - if the port is invalid

    • modifyPuertoEquipo

      public void modifyPuertoEquipo(Equipo equipo, Puerto oldPuerto, Puerto newPuerto) throws InvalidPuertoEquipoException
      Modifies an existing port (Puerto) of a device (Equipo).

      This method attempts to modify the port of the device in the network (Red). If the port is invalid and cannot be modified, an InvalidPuertoEquipoException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      equipo - the device (Equipo) whose port is to be modified
      oldPuerto - the old port to be replaced
      newPuerto - the new port to replace the old one
      Throws:
      InvalidPuertoEquipoException - if the port is invalid

    • getVertexMap

      public Map<String,Equipo> getVertexMap()
      Gets the map of devices (equipos) in the network.

      This method retrieves the map of devices from the logic layer.

      Returns:
      a map where the key is the device code and the value is the device

    • shortestPath

      public List<Conexion> shortestPath(Equipo equipo1, Equipo equipo2)
      Finds the shortest path between two devices (equipos) in the network.

      This method uses the logic layer to calculate the shortest path between the two specified devices.

      Parameters:
      equipo1 - the starting device
      equipo2 - the destination device
      Returns:
      a list of connections representing the shortest path between the two devices or null if no path is found

    • maxBandwith

      public Double maxBandwith(List<Conexion> sPath)
      Calculates the maximum bandwidth along a given path of connections (sPath).

      This method uses the logic layer to determine the maximum bandwidth available along the specified path of connections.

      Parameters:
      sPath - the list of connections representing the path
      Returns:
      the maximum bandwidth along the path

    • ping

      public boolean ping(String ip)
      Pings a device by its IP address.

      This method uses the logic layer to ping the specified IP address.

      Parameters:
      ip - the IP address to ping
      Returns:
      true if the ping is successful, false otherwise

    • pingRange

      public Map<String,Boolean> pingRange(Collection<String> ips)
      Pings a range of IP addresses.

      This method uses the logic layer to ping a collection of IP addresses.

      Parameters:
      ips - the collection of IP addresses to ping
      Returns:
      a map where the key is the IP address and the value is true if the ping is successful, false otherwise

    • getConnectedPart

      public org.jgrapht.Graph<Equipo,Conexion> getConnectedPart(Equipo equipo)
      Gets the connected part of the network for a given device (equipo).

      This method uses the logic layer to retrieve the subgraph of the network that is connected to the specified device.

      Parameters:
      equipo - the device for which to get the connected part of the network
      Returns:
      a set of connections representing the connected part of the network for the specified device

    • mapStatus

      public Map<Equipo,Boolean> mapStatus()
      Maps the status of each device (equipo) in the network.

      This method uses the logic layer to retrieve the status of each device in the network.

      Returns:
      a map where the key is the device and the value is true if the device is active, false otherwise

    • getResourceBundle

      public ResourceBundle getResourceBundle()
      Gets the resource bundle for internationalization.
      Returns:
      the resource bundle
